Our Chackochan
Chacko Receiving Award from Ministers
Chacko, Chairman of NMPC Trust recieving award from Kerala heath minister & Educational Minister.
Our Chackochan
NMPC Trust on Chackochan's Dream
This is the master plan designed for NMPC in future to met all the need and overcame the current limitations. With the help of kind people, we wish this dream comes true.

Welcome To New Malabar Punaradhivasa Kendram Charitable Trust

New Malabar Punaradhivasa Kendra Charitable Trust or NMPC family is located in Malappachery, a village in Madikai Grama Panchayath in kasargod district of Kerala.  This institution gives shelter to various kinds of painful lives such as orphans, elderly, disabled, mentally ill, blind, deaf and dumb, people who take shelter in the streets, people suffering from various kinds of illnesses, those who do not have anyone to help them, those who share food with dogs on the streets to quench their appetite, people with suicidal tendencies, bedridden patients etc.

In the religion of love, everyone lives here with satisfaction in their faith. “Mr.Chackochan, a person with 75% physical disabilities, provides support to the mentally and physically exhausted individuals”.

Our Organization

Non-profit, non-sectarian, non-religious, charitable trust who extent the care to the poor, needy and abandoned.

Get Involve

We need to construct separate blocks for ladies the mentally unstable. Due to limited facilities, we are unable to extent our help to people who are suffering.

Donate

Your small contribution could help us protect & care the poor, needy and abandoned peoples whom we are witnessing in daily life.

About Trust

Established in 2003, it has provided asylum to 1803 lives in the past 18 years. The organization which, currently has 115 inmates, includes men and women. The New Malabar Rehabilitation Center was functioning in a rented house at Pallikkara near Bekal in Kasargod district. Later, after selling the family property, 90 cents of land was bought at Malpachery in Madikai  Grama Panchayath and built a house there with local support. Over the past 16 years, the organization has been able to provide shelter to 1803 people.

Our Mission

The vision and mission of this institute is to extend care and share asylum for the poor, needy and abandoned.

We strive to give service with

  • Love
  • Care
  • Compassion

Our Activities

16 Years of NMPC Trust
  • In 16 years, NMPC Trust has provided shelter to 1803 people, displaced 275 people and reached them to their own shelters across the country.
  • They found lone patients and gave them excellent care.
  • Providing Caring for orphaned endosulfan patients.
  • Caring Isolated Mothers who have no one to help.
  • The operation was administered to 298 isolated patients.
  • Alcohol patients are liberated from it and educated their children.

Awards

Our Golden Years!
Previous
Next

What We Do

There are still human beings in our cities who share food in the garbage heaps with dogs to gratify their hunger. Such lives are depicted by the society as insane when they plead for a meal. The mission of New Malabar Punanradhivasa Kendra Charitable Trust is to become a support and shade for such fleeing lives.

Old Age Home

Special care with Assistance for Old Age People.

What We Need To Our New Project

We have started the construction of new blocks for NMPC trust. But due to shortage of resources and lack of public support, construction is stuck at its pillar. We need more help from you to complete the dream project.
What We Need
  • As per the Government Norms, we are forced to construct a separate building for female patients.
  • The upper roofs of our Kitchen, Dining hall, Dormitory are covered with plastic roofs. It should be replaced with concrete roofs
  • As we accept all types of patients, it is our duty to provide then-adequate facilities.
  • As per Government Norms, each patient should get 40.Sq. Ft room facilities with two bathrooms and two toilets to 10 patients and so on. To ensure facilities for the construction of E well planned building, we need financial assistance from the Government
  • We humbly request the authorities kindly allocate adequate the norms fixed by the government.
  • A home that is accessible to all who see it
  • A self employing center for the disabled persons
  • We would like to start a physiotherapy center for the elderly and the disabled persons

Current Building of NMPC Trust
